result.execSummary:
The defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge.   Pay the costs and disbursements from monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision and then probation on other counts.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision are same as probation conditions on other counts of this case.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Rita D. or Lachelle R.
No contact with the Walgreens at 6101 W. Greenfield Avenue, City of West Allis, County of Milwaukee.
No contact with the Walgreens at 5400 N. Port Washington Road, City of Glendale, County of Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with the Walgreens at 8615 N. Port Wshingtoin Rd, in the village of Fox Pint, County of Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with the DVS Pharmacy at 9220 W. Greenfield Avenue, City of Westa Allis, County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No contact with the CVS Pharmacy at 7520 W. Bluemound Road, City of Wauwatosa, County of Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with the CVS Pharmacy at 3030 W. Villard Avenue, City and County of Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with the CVS Pharmacy at 240 E. Villard, Village of Whitefish Bay, County of Milwaukee, WI.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.
Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.

Pay DNA surcharge in count three four and six, plus DNA surcharge if any balance is remaining on count two; plus all costs, disbursements and supervision fees, and restitution.  
Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison on counts three, four and six,  all to be taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision. 
Failure to pay would result in a civil jugment entered agaisnt defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
$177.42 to CVS Pharmacy 7520 W. Bluemound Road;

records.addlTxt: PLEA AND SENTENCING Original Transcript (51 pages) commencing JUNE 4, 2014 received and filed.  cg

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore not in court, in custody. Branch 20 in trial. Case is adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Elizabeth Anne Carlson in court, defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested an adjournment, as she just received an offer from the State, including global resolution of defendant's two misdemeanors.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore not in court, in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in Waukesha County.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-11-2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL CVS AND WALGREENS STORES  IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY; WADE D., ANGELA S., RITA D., KARLA V., SANDRA P-L., ELIZABETH M., RAQUEL G., STEPHANIE J., ESTER Q., MATEO R., ANDREW K., SHANAVE B., DWAIN B., JACOB W. AND HAROLD Y. (EMPLOYEES OF CVS AND WALGREENS STORES).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring AND DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore in court with Student Intern MICHAEL BECKMAN under the supervision of ATTORNEY Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Daiveon Demetrius Moore in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
